article:
The '1997â98 Football League Cup' (known as the 'Coca-Cola Cup' for sponsorship
reasons) was the 38th Football League Cup, a knockout competition for England's
top 92 football clubs. The competition name reflects a sponsorship deal with
soft drinks brand Coca-Cola, who were in the last year of their multi-million
pound deal. The competition began on 11 August 1997, and ended with the final on
29 March 1998, held at Wembley Stadium.

The tournament was won by Chelsea, who beat Middlesbrough 2–0 in
the final.
